sentence.Network_en: Try to anticipate what your child will do and forestall problems.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽量预见你的孩子会干什么，并预先阻止问题发生。

sentence.Network_en: To forestall is better than to amend.
sentence.Network_cn: 与其补救于已然,不如防范于未然.
尽量不让他们问问题(作到先发制人).

Although free capitalism develops forestall capitalism , employ form produced change , but force remains commodity ., 尽管自由资本主义发展到垄断资本主义 , 雇佣形式等发生了变化 , 但劳动力仍然是商品.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English foresteall 'an ambush' (see fore- and stall). As a verb the earliest sense (Middle English) was 'intercept and buy up (goods) before they reach the market, so as to raise the price' (formerly an offence)

entry.tran: 预先阻止;抢在…之前行动
entry.def: If you forestall someone, you realize what they are likely to do and prevent them from doing it.

example.ex: O'Leary made to open the door, but Bunbury forestalled him by laying a hand on his arm...
example.tran: 奥利里想去开门，但是邦伯里抢先一把摁住了他的胳膊。

example.ex: Large numbers of police were in the square to forestall any demonstrations.
example.tran: 广场上驻守着大批警察以防止任何示威活动。

means.word_mean: 1. keep from happening or arising; have the effect of preventing;

sentences.sentence: "My sense of tact forbids an honest answer"

means.word_mean: 2. act in advance of; deal with ahead of time

auth_sentence.content: I would forestall the launch of a national campaign.
auth_sentence.res_content: I would forestall the launch of a national campaign.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I would forestall the launch of a national campaign.

auth_sentence.content: No amount of intellectual engineering can forestall the inevitable.
auth_sentence.res_content: No amount of intellectual engineering can forestall the inevitable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No amount of intellectual engineering can forestall the inevitable.

auth_sentence.content: Eventually, it will, to forestall inflation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Eventually, it will, to forestall inflation.

fore前面,预先+shadow影子→影子预先来
fore预先+stall放→预先放上东西→制止
